result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Flee Or Elude An Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay mandatory costs, fees and surcharges including DNA by 4/15/2024.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence. Good time credit.  Huber privileges for work.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176 the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald Harris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donald Harris in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Donald Harris in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 
as to Count 1: Defendant ordered to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, good time credit, Huber privileges for work. 
defendant to pay mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, by 04-15-2024.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Plea/sentencing hearing moved from 03-24-2022 to 04-15-2022 at 3:30 pm by Zoom

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

2630 jury instruction

2663 jury instructions

Defendant Donald Harris in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom / room *.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Donald Harris in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Donald Harris in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Glendale Officer - A. Nazario-Garcia. Stipulation to the identification of the defendant agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Donald Harris in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Donald Harris in custody.  Mario Fiumefreddo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Donald Harris appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
